poem:
Title: The Dance of the Market

In the morning press, profit's song sings,
John Lewis waltzes with gains and things.
Yet the staff's bonus, a mirage at most,
Bitcoin's crescendo is their sheer ghost.

Housing questions rise with the sun,
Listings like daisies, each a promising run.
Surveyors twirl in a cautious ballet,
The unseen future, a subtle soothsay.
